results.title: Communication by voice and action
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the importance of gestures, expression, posture, voice and body movement in communication. Communication is a two way process between the speaker and the listener, so things must be said and done to clearly indicate the speaker’s thoughts and feelings.

results.title: Communication and motivation: dealing successfully with today's students
results.brief_description: One of a series in which Dr William Glasser presents a problem solving approach for individuals in therapeutic situations and which can be applied to discipline in schools. Glasser combines his discussion of the Schools Without Failure concepts, and examines the ways in which motivation can be encouraged - laughter and fun, and the importance of self expression give a child recognition that will motivate him to work. Suitable for tertiary level and teachers.

results.title: Communicating with a group
results.creator_credit: John Krish and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Manager in Action”.
This film takes the form of a dramatised in-company training session on group communication. The film is designed to improve the abilities of people to communicate effectively with all groups. The special problems of communication with groups are identified.

results.title: Communicating in a team
results.brief_description: This video is a guide as to how to communicate better in a team environment. The first recommended step is to accept the diversity of the modern workplace and the array of backgrounds of staff members. This means having patience and understanding that those from another cultural background may find it harder to absorb instructions. Tolerance is the key to successful team environments. The second recommended step is to participate in meetings, listen to each other and show interest, stay on track, and do not divert from the meeting’s main topic; be open to ideas, don’t jump in early and trounce others’ ideas. Lastly, ask your manager for feedback. Be specific and probe for precise ways in which to improve your performance.

results.title: Communicating change
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, Australia Post and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English at work”.
This program examines the issues of managing change in the workplace. It shows the importance for everyone in the workplace to understand what changes are going to happen, why they are happening and how everyone will be affected by them.
